cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 460 miles E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west toward the northwestern Bahamas Tuesday night, then west-northwest and turning northwest across the Florida Peninsula toward southern Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast near Boca Raton–West Palm Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Hallandale Beach to north of Ocean Reef, FL (includes Biscayne Bay/PortMiami area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Boca Raton to Flagler/Volusia County Line (north of PortMiami)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of Florida’s east coast from Boca Raton northward to Altamaha Sound GA; surge watch south to Ocean Reef and west coast Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: PortMiami could experience tropical-storm-force gusts (39–45 mph) beginning Wednesday evening and continuing into Thursday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible in Biscayne Bay and along the Miami waterfront.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with isolated higher totals could cause urban/flash flooding Wednesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the Miami-Dade coastline.
